title: NASA Sets Coverage for Northrop Grumman Cygnus Departure from Station
summary: Carrying more than 8,200 pounds of supplies, scientific investigations, commercial products, hardware, and other cargo to the orbiting laboratory for NASA, Northrop Grumman’s uncrewed Cygnus spacecraft is scheduled to depart the International Space Station Friday, April 21.

title: Europe’s Ariane 6 rocket is turning into a space policy disaster
summary: Now the Ariane 6 rocket is failing even its most basic task.

title: Axiom announces new government human spaceflight program
summary: Axiom Space has introduced a new program to allow countries to create human spaceflight programs without needing to develop their own infrastructure or other capabilities.

title: Inmarsat working to restore L-band services in Asia Pacific after satellite outage
summary: An aging Inmarsat satellite that pilots use to keep in touch with air traffic control beyond the range of very high frequency (VHF) ground radars is experiencing a prolonged outage.

title: Northrop Grumman clears design hurdle for military communications satellite
summary: Northrop Grumman completed a critical design review of a Space Development Agency communications satellite in 13 months, a fraction of the time required for traditional space programs.

title: ESA working on human spaceflight scenarios for European space summit
summary: The European Space Agency is preparing for a space summit this fall to win support for a new human spaceflight initiative as well as a new launch strategy.

title: AWS chooses 14 startups for its third space accelerator program
summary: Amazon Web Services said April 18 it picked 14 U.S. and European startups to join its third annual space accelerator program kicking off in May to boost ventures with solutions for improving space sustainability.

title: Export control update on the way
summary: Export control rules promised in 2019, when the U.S. State Department Directorate of Defense Trade Controls and the Commerce Department Bureau of Industry and Security announced plans to revise the U.S. Munitions List, are likely to be published by the end of the year.

title: Speed and safety are top priorities for regulators
summary: Efforts to streamline and accelerate space licensing procedures to keep up with rapid innovation are bearing fruit, according to a Space Symposium panel of regulators.

title: Lamborn urges military leaders to be less secretive on space issues
summary: Rep. Doug Lamborn (R-Colo.) said it might be time for the Defense Department to start more open discussions about the national security challenges the United States faces in the space domain.
